Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which was found at Oxyrhynchus (P.Oxy. VI 998) and which dates to the end of the 6th century of our time, relates to an account of allocations (?) of corn and in money to the villagers.
